page.title: 01Village Communities
page.content: This area has been inhabited since {pre-Celtic}times.{Hedge counts}show road and field patterns which dominate the landscape, to be very old. Small woods and copses add to the patchwork effect. Almost all the area is given over to small independent{farms. { Denbury, Ipplepen}and{Broadhempston are separate, close-knit thriving village communities providing homes for commuters to the nearby towns and, for retired people, also the hamlet of {Torbryan. New homes have been built}in Denbury and Ipplepen since 1960. Small growth is planned for Broadhempston, none at Torbryan.There has been an influx of people from all over Britain. Only a small percentage of each village is second or third generation 'native'. { INFORMATION ON BROADHEMPSTON IS ON {GRID REF.02770063.
